transcripts.text: Hello everyone, so another day and another Brexit chaos.  For everyone who's been following this channel, obviously on a daily basis we are giving you updates on what's happening in the UK and with the whole Brexit scenario.  So yesterday and today what we've had is opposition parties who have been asking for a long time to have a general election, they got together and said basically they have confidence in Boris Johnson and the government by rejecting the call to have a snap election.  And this morning we had the court case that Juno Miller and John Major had to stop Boris from proroguing Parliament.  That failed as well.  So Boris Johnson now has the power to prorogue Parliament as planned and the only way for the Remainers to stop Brexit is to keep pushing for their bill to force Boris Johnson to go to the European Council and ask for an extension.  But again, they don't see the flaw in that.  But today we're going to talk about last night and BBC Question Time panel because the people of this country are finally fed up with politicians, especially from the Remain side, who are wasting their time and instead of actually respecting democracy and delivering what they promised to do.  First, let's start with the SNP.
But on this issue of trust, because this is really important, what we've got is Boris Johnson, in an anti-democratic way, is shutting down Parliament.
He's proroguing Parliament to fire him in a way which is absolutely unprecedented.

He did it by sending three of his ministers to see the Queen, three privy councillors, three stooges if you like.  that told the Queen that she must give the authority for Boris Johnson to stop parliamentarians taking us out of the European Union on an ordeal basis.

Firstly, it's funny because it says it's against the law to suspend parliament.  Obviously, we've seen the court case failing, so it is legal.  And secondly, it's not really a suspension.  Parliament is not going to be in session because of the conference season and what Boris' government is going to be doing is just add three or four more days on top of it so that we could have a Queen's speech.  It's been a while since we had one.  Next is the Labour manifesto from 2017 being exposed because the Labour Party did promise in 2017 to leave the European Union.

I have a direct quote from the Labour manifesto in 2017.  Page 24, Labour accepts the referendum result.  Now, in the last two years, you have said that you want to campaign against the referendum.  You want to scrap that result.  So why should anyone trust you?
Why should anyone trust you?  Emily talked about liars.

Yeah.  Emily, in November 17, in an interview with The Guardian, you said, I quote, I don't think we should be undermining our democracy.  You just can't do it.  You just can't do it.  And now you want to stop Brexit completely.  You want to campaign for remain.  So that actually makes you a liar.

Yes, as usual, no proper response from the Labour Party or Emily Thornberry.  But the main point of last night's Question Time was that the panel of politicians managed to finally make people go crazy.  And one audience member said what we all think.

I'm looking at all of you as everybody is and people watching on TV and the opinion that people have of all of you guys that are in Parliament, in positions of power, is that you are absolutely disgraceful.
People voted.

People voted in the referendum to leave the EU.  You are not respecting it.  All I hear is I this, I that, I that, the brother doesn't like the brother, and this and that, and it's absolutely pathetic.  We are, this country is having a tremendous bad reputation abroad, and it's all thanks to you.

All of you guys in Parliament that cannot go ahead with the wish of 17.4 million people that want to leave.  And she's absolutely right.  It's been completely astonishing.  I have friends from across the world, in Europe and in America, who are contacting me saying, what on earth is going on?  This is the mother of all parliaments.  This is the birthplace of modern democracy and we can't even deliver one simple policy.  But the highlight of last night was when the Labour Party's policy on Brexit was exposed.  because Well, watch it first.

If you were to win a general election, which I think is the point you're getting to, you would go back to Europe, try and get a better deal, have a referendum where remain is an option.  Would you then be campaigning against your own deal to remain?  Against your own deal that you probably would have negotiated?  Or would you be actually saying, no, support our deal?  I mean, if I'm confused, I don't know...
Which is it?  Briefly.
Are you going to campaign for your deal, assuming you get one, assuming you get into power?
I think we've had our answer.

Or will you campaign for Remain?  against your own deal?  Personally, I will campaign to remain.  Even if you've negotiated the deal?  I will negotiate to the best of my ability a deal that will look after jobs and the economy, but the best way to look after jobs and the economy is for us to remain.
Do you have any idea how ridiculous that sounds?  I think you think people are going to vote for you on that basis.
Have you no shame?
Have you any idea how the European Union are going to treat us if we negotiate in that way?  Can you give us a nice deal, please?  And then I'm going to vote not to have it in the first place.

So I find it quite interesting that there are still about 24, 25 percent of this country who are willing to vote for the Labour Party.  The same Labour Party that are saying on the one hand, well Brexit's happened so let's try to do something about it.  and on the other hand they say, well we're gonna make a deal with Europe and we're gonna make the best deal ever and then we're gonna have a referendum and we're gonna campaign against our own deal.  But if you think that's bad, next is the Liberal Democrats who are openly and publicly saying they are against democracy.
Good.  Thank goodness.
Hang on.  Do you believe in democracy?
I believe in stopping Brexit.  We are crystal clear.
So you don't believe in democracy?  We had a vote three and a quarter years ago.  You don't believe in democracy?
And you know what?  I was elected in a general election in 2017.

We're already talking about having another one.  What's so wrong about going back to the people and saying, do you really want this cliff edge?  no deal?  Or would you rather stay in and actually make the stop and just ask if it was what they wanted?
I don't see anything wrong with that.
Democracy only works if you have the thing called loser's consent.

To be fair, I don't even know how to respond to that.  So on the one hand, at least you know where you stand with the Lib Dem remainers.  But on the other hand, I think it's just a waste of time trying to debate with them because they don't understand reason.  They don't understand the basics of democracy, politics or economics or any policy for that matter.  So let's just move on.  Next, we had an audience member who was a Romaine voter, the typical person who says things that would frustrate the majority of the people in this country.  Let's watch it.
This is a true belief that most people that voted in the referendum don't understand what happened.  What I feel these days...
I have to say, as I go around the country... Often when people say that there is the most enormous groan from people because a lot of people feel they did know what they were voting for.
Absolutely, I don't believe that.
Absolutely.
I truly don't believe that.  I also believe that...
Sir, are you insulting the intelligence of 17.4 million people in this town?
Wait a minute, could you finish your point?  Yeah, let me finish, thank you.  And I also believe that politicians are fearless these days.

What's interesting about this clip and this person is that on the one hand it says that people don't understand things so basically they shouldn't get a vote.  On the other hand he says something that proves that he doesn't know what he's talking about because He says politicians, he says, are fearless.  It's literally the other way around.  It's because politicians are so fearful of not just their constituents, but anything that goes around, investments, that they can't make a decision.  That's the problem we have with our democracy because we don't have, in the words of Theresa May, strong and stable politicians.  And the only people we now see right now in the country who are strong and stable are the Boris Johnson's government, the Brexit party, because you know they have conviction, whether you disagree or agree with their policies, you know what they want to do.  But the problem of Western's the bubble and politicians being out of touch is going even further and deeper because they are spending all their time in the House of Commons and in Parliament, not really debating, but just shouting over each other and interrupting each other.  And we had a perfect evidence and example of that last night.
A deal, I believe him to be serious about wanting a deal.
There's no negotiations going on.  There are no negotiations going on.
Let Ian answer the question.
I think he's serious about wanting...
There's no negotiations.
For goodness sake, what is the point of trying to have a debate when after every five seconds you interrupt?
Ian, Ian, Ian, I have asked him a question and I want to hear the answer.  Ian, Ian, I want to hear the answer.
Do you want to hear the answer?  Yes!

And I'm fully with Ian Dale because if I were on that panel, I would be completely frustrated too.  And the final clip we have, I know I said earlier that there's no point in debating or even considering the Lib Dem Remainers, but it's good to expose them for what they actually are.  Because Ian Dale brought up the point that Jo Swinson, the leader of the Liberal Democrats, saying the other day that she is a pro-Democrat.  But at the same time, if there is another vote and if Brexit wins, she would still not accept it.

Leila, your leader, Jay Swinson, has said that even if there was a second referendum and the result was... Hang on, let me finish.  She said that if there was another referendum and the result was leave, she would not accept that result.  How democratic is that?  How can you call yourself a Liberal Democrat when you have a leader that says that?
My understanding on that is that she believes as I do.  Actually, what we are seeing right now is a complete realignment of where people feel our place is in the world as Britain.

Yes, that's where we are now.  But the mood in the country is completely changing.  The people are now against politicians.  And it's about time, to be fair, politicians were to be held to account properly.  So if they don't sort out their problems in Parliament... I would not be surprised if people become completely fed up and do something about it.  And if we don't get our election, it's going to be even worse.  Let's see how this weekend goes and how the next week where we're going to come back and do more videos and see where we are with these people.  but as I said last night don't panic just yet if you're a Brexiteer because there's still a chance and for example even if they force Boris Johnson with this bill to force him to go to the EU to ask for an extension he could basically just ignore it and by the time they try to object to it and legally challenge it we have left the EU.  so Even if they don't give us our general election just yet, we should be able to still leave the EU.  But obviously, don't take anything for granted because they could come back with something new that we don't know.  But in the meantime, try to have a great weekend.  Don't watch any news during this weekend because there's going to be a lot more next week.  So if you want to follow me on social media, Twitter, Instagram, the link's somewhere down there.  if you want to become a member of the cabinet club to support the channel I'll put the link in the description and don't forget to subscribe and click on notification button next to it.  otherwise you won't get notified when I release a new video.  every video videos are up every day at 6 p.m.  Monday to Friday and have a great weekend and I'll see you on Monday with a new video.
